TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ObjectDesignerDataSourceView extends System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerDataSourceView

Docs.summary: Provides the design-time view that is associated with the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource> control represents a data source that calls methods of a business object in order to perform the Delete, Insert, Select, and Update database-type operations.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDataSourceDesigner> class provides design-time support for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource> control in a visual designer. An <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDesignerDataSourceView> object provides members that indicate whether various database-type operations can be performed and that return schema and design-time data.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDesignerDataSourceView.CanInsert%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDesignerDataSourceView.CanUpdate%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDesignerDataSourceView.CanDelete%2A> properties indicate whether the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource> control can perform the corresponding database-type operations.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDesignerDataSourceView.CanSort%2A> property, which is always `true`, indicates that the associated control can sort rows. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDesignerDataSourceView.CanPage%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDesignerDataSourceView.CanRetrieveTotalRowCount%2A> properties, which are always `false`, indicate that the associated control cannot perform server paging and cannot return the total number of rows in a query, respectively.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDesignerDataSourceView.Schema%2A> property gets a schema that describes the data source view that is represented by this view object. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDesignerDataSourceView.GetDesignTimeData%2A> method generates design-time data that matches the schema of the associated control.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDataSourceDesigner owner, string viewName) cil managed

Docs.param: A string containing the name of this object.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The .NET Framework creates a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDesignerDataSourceView> class when requested by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDataSourceDesigner.GetView%2A> method of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDataSourceDesigner> object that is associated with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource> control on the visual designer surface.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the associated data source control as it is currently configured can perform a Delete operation.
Docs.value: if the associated can perform a Delete operation; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDesignerDataSourceView.CanDelete%2A> property returns `true` if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource.DeleteMethod%2A> property of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource> control contains a value other than the empty string ("").

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the associated data source control as it is currently configured can perform an Insert operation.
Docs.value: if the associated can perform an Insert operation; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDesignerDataSourceView.CanInsert%2A> property returns `true` if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource.InsertMethod%2A> property of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource> control contains a value other than the empty string ("").

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the associated data source control can perform server-based paging.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDesignerDataSourceView.CanPage%2A> property indicates that <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource> controls cannot perform server-based paging.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the associated data source control can return the total number of rows that are returned by a query.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDesignerDataSourceView.CanRetrieveTotalRowCount%2A> property indicates that <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource> controls cannot return result-set row counts.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the associated data source control can sort rows.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDesignerDataSourceView.CanSort%2A> property indicates that <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource> controls can sort result-set rows. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource.SortParameterName%2A> property specifies the parameter in the collection that is referenced by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource.SelectParameters%2A> property that is used to define the sort expression.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the associated data source control as it is currently configured can perform an Update operation.
Docs.value: if the associated can perform an Update operation; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDesignerDataSourceView.CanUpdate%2A> property returns `true` if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource.UpdateMethod%2A> property of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource> control contains a value other than the empty string ("").

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Collections.IEnumerable GetDesignTimeData (int minimumRows, out bool isSampleData);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Collections.IEnumerable GetDesignTimeData(int32 minimumRows, bool isSampleData) cil managed

Docs.param: An integer containing the minimum number of rows to retrieve.
A value indicating whether the data returned is sample data or real data.
Docs.summary: Generates design-time data that matches the schema of the associated data source control.
Docs.returns: A sample of the data represented by the associated or if the designer cannot generate any sample data.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDesignerDataSourceView.GetDesignTimeData%2A> method provides a design-time version of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource> view for use by the associated data-bound control designer.
It is not expected that the designer will perform actual data access at design-time time. Instead, the designer creates sample data that matches the schema of the data source.

Docs.summary: Gets a schema that describes the data source view that is represented by this view object.
Docs.value: An object implementing the that describes the view and the properties of the objects in the list or if the schema is unavailable.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDesignerDataSourceView.Schema%2A> property gets the schema tables from the associated designer. If any <xref:System.Data.DataTable> objects are returned, the schema selects the <xref:System.Data.DataTable> with the same <xref:System.Data.DataTable.TableName%2A> property as this view object, or it selects the first <xref:System.Data.DataTable> if this view has no name. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDesignerDataSourceView.Schema%2A> then creates and returns a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetViewSchema> object from the selected <xref:System.Data.DataTable>.
This allows the designer of a data-bound control to provide relevant choices based on the design-time data source view that is selected for data binding.
